result.execSummary:
Todd Kenneth Heitkemper was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Todd Kenneth Heitkemper was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd Kenneth Heitkemper

defendant.name: Heitkemper, Todd Kenneth
defendant.address: Green County Jail 2827 6th Street, Monroe, WI 53566

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM Todd Kenneth Heitkemper, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel C. James Fitzgerald.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney.
DA Nolen responds that this matter is not eligible for bail.  Court - this is on for a request for a governor's warrant by the State of Montana.  Atty Fitzgerald indicates Mr Heitkemper does not contest the request and waives the extradition proceeding.   Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant given complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.  Court provides the document as to extradition proceedings to Mr. Heitkemper who had a document provided to him during the reading on the record.
Extradition hearing on February 15, 2022 at 11:15 am.

01:16 PM Todd Kenneth Heitkemper, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Alli M Welch appearing on behalf of Attorney Fitzgerald. Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. DE received a copy of the Extradition. DE would like to speak to Attorney Fitzgerald. DE is not eligable for bond. Matter set over.  Extradition hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 11:15 am.
